snippet: Homeowners who suffered wind and storm damage this week will get financial relief from rulings that insurers must treat Sandy as a tropical storm and not a hurricane.
abstract: Tens of thousands of homeowners who suffered wind and storm damage from Hurricane Sandy will get financial relief from rulings by several governors that insurers must treat event as a tropical storm and not as a hurricane; insurance policies in coastal areas almost always include a provision that deductible will be higher when damage is caused by a hurricane than a lesser windstorm.

byline.original: By MARY WILLIAMS WALSH and SHAILA DEWAN

lead_paragraph: Homeowners who suffered wind and storm damage this week will get financial relief from rulings that insurers must treat Sandy as a tropical storm and not a hurricane.

headline.main: Governors Promote Lower Deductibles for Homeowners
headline.print_headline: Governors’ Rulings Mean Lower Deductibles for Storm-Tossed Homeowners
